arts.ttl: Wasteful Wycombe held at home by struggling Shrewsbury
Shrewsbury Town: Roland Wycherley still 'fully committed' to selling club
arts.sum: The chairman of almost three decades accepts the era of a local businessman running a football club is ‘coming to an end’ - but with him still needing to sell the club before moving on, he says there have already been new expressions of interest. "As I have said in prior statements, previously, my intention has been to find a successor who was a local businessman who had the club’s and the town’s best interests at heart.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town on the hunt for new owners once again
arts.sum: The doubt was because the former head coach had gone on record to say how much of an impact the potential takeover had on his decision to come to Shropshire in the first place. Doubts about whether the takeover was going to happen began to creep in as the period of exclusivity went on without there being an update.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town boss to receive update following reports a takeover has collapsed
arts.sum: And, you know, once I get it clarified from the club, then obviously you'll have to ask me this question again tomorrow night or whenever it is. The Salop boss, who was only announced on Wednesday last week, held training with his Shrewsbury squad on Monday morning ahead of their game with Wycombe Wanderers on Tuesday night.

arts.ttl: 'I need to renew my season ticket, but I don't know whether I want to' - Shrewsbury Town fans react to takeover collapse
arts.sum: However, the news didn't come as a surprise to the 41-year-old, who said: "It makes sense why Ainsworth left. But, when the news broke last week that manager Gareth Ainsworth was leaving the club and heading to Gillingham of League Two, uncertainty grew over whether this takeover would go ahead.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town analysis: Tough week ends with all too familiar tale
arts.sum: Of course, everybody is well aware of the quality that Chris Davies' Birmingham City possess within their ranks, and as a result, no sensible Shrewsbury Town fan would have gone to St Andrew's on the weekend expecting their side to get a result. With Shrewsbury's relegation, which is almost certain at this stage, days out like Saturday, where they head to a stadium full of more than 26,000 supporters, will be few and far between as they drop into the fourth tier of English football.

arts.ttl: Preview: Wycombe Wanderers vs. Shrewsbury Town - prediction, team news, lineups
